info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 8 at 3:40PM EDT until May 8 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of central, south central, and west central Indiana, including the following counties, in central Indiana, Morgan. In south central Indiana, Brown and Monroe. In west central Indiana, Owen.
* WHEN...Until 645 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 339 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen near Ellettsville. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bloomington, Spencer, Ellettsville, Gosport, Stinesville, Indiana University, Whitehall, Unionville, Lake Lemon, Woodville Hills, Yellowwood Lake, Helmsburg, McCormicks Creek State Park and Beanblossom. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Brown, IN; Monroe, IN; Morgan, IN; Owen, IN
